summary: The SENIOR Act (S. 473) amends the Older Americans Act of 1965 to address loneliness among older individuals. It mandates screening for loneliness and coordination of supportive services and healthcare. The bill requires the Secretary to prepare a report examining programs addressing loneliness, the relationship between family units and loneliness, and public awareness. The report includes recommendations for reducing negative health effects and fostering intergenerational connections. Interim and final reports are to be submitted to relevant congressional committees.
